metadata.title: CVE-2024-26665 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:tunnels: fix out of bounds access when building IPv6 PMTU error If theICMPv6 error is built from a non-linear skb we get the following splat,BUG: KASAN: slab-out-of-bounds in do_csum+0x220/0x240 Read of size 4 ataddr ffff88811d402c80 by task netperf/820 CPU: 0 PID: 820 Comm: netperf Nottainted 6.8.0-rc1+ #543 ... kasan_report+0xd8/0x110 do_csum+0x220/0x240csum_partial+0xc/0x20 skb_tunnel_check_pmtu+0xeb9/0x3280vxlan_xmit_one+0x14c2/0x4080 vxlan_xmit+0xf61/0x5c00dev_hard_start_xmit+0xfb/0x510 __dev_queue_xmit+0x7cd/0x32a0br_dev_queue_push_xmit+0x39d/0x6a0 Use skb_checksum instead of csum_partialwho cannot deal with non-linear SKBs.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-26665` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic-64k - 6.8.0-31.31
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1008-aws - 6.8.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-azure - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-gcp - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-lowlatency - 6.8.0-31.31.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-lowlatency-64k - 6.8.0-31.31.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-oracle - 6.8.0-1005.5
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-oracle-64k - 6.8.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-6.8.0-1004-raspi - 6.8.0-1004.4
No subscription required
